content.description: Start under overlap, climb and clip two bolts. Spy the sick flake feature and figure out how you are going to get there. Awesome liebacking leads to easier ground. Make a commiting move to an undercling and bust hard left. Follow the undercling until it runs dry. Take a breath and get ready to boulder. Crush the boulder problem in the wicked water grove, clip a "thank dog" bolt and run it to the chains. Classic mixed route.
content.protection: 3 bolts, gear to 1" (optional 3" piece) #3 nut is nice for upper crux. long slings up high minimize gnarly rope drag.
content.location: 70m rope lowers to the ground. carabiner anchors.

content.description: Climb the thin face/slab left of 'Robert Plant'. Starts out nice and easy. Gets harder and harder the higher you get. Cool unique holds turn into micro edges and smears. Expect strenuous clips and insecure climbing. Pull a reachy crux midway, spy the last three bolts, and delicately make your way to the big flake. Layback your way to the fun, easy roof crack.
content.protection: 9 bolts, gear to 3" for the flake and roof. shares anchors w/Robert Plant

content.description: You can't miss this one. 4th class scrambling leads to the base of a massive flaring chimney in the middle of the wall. Climb the dingy, crumbly beginning to the base of the chimney. Clip the rouge bolt, then squeeze and squirm your way up the amazing black chimney protecting any chance you get. Gear placements are sparse and creative. Build a gear anchor once you reach the alcove with the short overhanging roof crack just above your head. Plug as much gear in the crack as you can from your tippy toes, raise your psych level, and fire the strenuous roof crack. *(Attentive belay is key here, especially for the second.) Pull around the corner at the lip of the roof and soak up the wild exposure as you head for the slab. Climbed from the ground up. Very Yosemite-esque.
content.protection:
Gear to 3", 1 bolt, nuts and small cams useful, extra long slings for chock stones.

Gear anchor (2x3",1x2"). Second pitch has bolted anchor.

One 70m rope. Rap to 'Levee' anchors then rap again.

Bring a crashpad for the second pitch.
content.location: the massive chimney in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Climb the chimney, pull a challenging overhanging flake, tiptoe through the "Plant", climb the fun lieback, and finish via the corner roof crack. Super fun!!
content.location: the route farthest right on the wall.

content.description: Climb the black water streak on perfect rock. Perfect warm up.
content.location: left of 'Squeeze my lemon' and right of 'Echoes'

content.description: Climb the perfect slab for two pitches. Can be done as one 70m pitch. Bolted from the ground up.
content.protection: 11 bolts for 70m. Bring a long sling for first anchor if done as one pitch.
content.location: Currently the left most route. left of 'Faraway Laughter'

content.description: Climb the flakes and underclings to the first bolt and clip from the ledge, then make a long reach (or lunge) for a right hand sidepull/crimp. More fun thin moves get you to a mantle and undercling at the mid-point of the climb.  The second crux guards a rest at a ledge. Finish with interesting climbing and a balancy move at the anchors.
content.location: This route is the second from the right on the Avalanche Wall after "Robert Plant".
